(45) 27.12th January, 1945FRANCO-SOVIET TREATY OF ALLIANCE.Memorandum by the Secretary of State for Foreign Affairs.I circulate, for the information of my colleagues, a translation of the Frenchtext of the Treaty of Alliance and Mutual Assistance between the French republic and the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics, signed in - Moscow on the10th December, 1944.A. E.Foreign Office, 12th January, 1945.ANNEX.THE Provisional Government of the French Republic and the Presidium ofthe Supreme Council of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics,Determined to continue the war against Germany in common and to the end,Convinced that when victory is achieved the re-establishment of peace on a firm basis and its prolonged maintenance in the future will depend upon theexistence of close collaboration between them and with all the United Nations,Having resolved to work together for the creation of an internationalsecurity system which will make possible the effective maintenance of generalpeace and safeguard the harmonious development of international relations,Desiring to confirm their mutual obligations under the exchange of letters ofthe 20th September, 1941, regarding joint action in the war against Germany, *Convinced that by concluding an alliance between France and the Union of soviet Socialist Republics they are acting in accordance with the sentiments and interests of both peoples and with the requirements of war as well as the needsof peace and economic reconstruction, in full conformity with the aims of theUnited Nations,Have decided to conclude a Treaty for this purpose and have appointed as their plenipotentiaries,The Provisional Government of the French Republic :M. Georges Bidault, Minister of Foreign Affairs;The Presidium of the Supreme Council of the Union of Soviet socialist republics :M. Vyacheslav Mikhailovich Molotov, People's Commissar for ForeignAffairs of the Union of Soviet Socialist Republics,Who, having communicated their full powers, found in good and due form,have agreed as follows : *Article 1.Each contracting party will continue at the other's side and that of theUnited Nations to fight until final victory over Germany. Each contracting partyundertakes to render aid and assistance to the other in this struggle with ahmeans at its disposal.12634 [29026]Copy No.WAR CABINET. Article 2.The High Contracting Parties will neither enter into separate negotiationswith Germany nor conclude without mutual agreement an armistice or a peace treaty either with the Hitlerite Government or with any other Government orauthority which may be set up in Germany with the object of prolonging ornourishing a policy of German aggression.The High Contracting Parties undertake to adopt by mutual agreement atthe end of the present conflict with Germany all necessary measures in orderto eliminate any future threat emanating from Germany and to bar the way toany initiative which might render possible a fresh attempt at aggression on her part.Should either High Contracting Party find itself involved in hostilities withGermany, as a result either of aggression by Germany or of the operation ofArticle 3 above, the other Party will immediately render it all aid and assistancein its power.Article 5.The High Contracting Parties undertake not to conclude any alliance or take part in any coalition aimed against either of them.Article 6.The High Contracting Parties agree to render each other all possible economic assistance after the war in order to facilitate and hasten the reconstruction ofboth countries and to contribute to the prosperity of the world.Article 7.The present Treaty does not affect in any way previous engagementscontracted by the Parties with third States in virtue of published treaties.The present Treaty, the French and Russian texts of which are equally valid,shall be ratified and the instruments of ratification exchanged in Paris as soonas possible.It shall enter into force as soon as the instruments of ratification have been exchanged and shall remain in force for 20 years. If not denounced at least one year previous to the expiry of this period by either High Contracting Party,it shall remain in force indefinitely, either High Contracting Party retaining the right to terminate it by a declaration to this effect with one year's notice.In pledge of which the above-mentioned plenipotentiaries have signed thepresent Treaty and have affixed their seals.Done at Moscow in duplicate on the 10th day of December, 1944.Article 3.Article 4.Article 8.BTDAULT,Minister of Foreign Affairs.MOLOTOV,People's Commissar of foreign ffairs.
